In Southeast Asia, India, South China, Indonesia, Cambodia, Vietnam and Thailand, plants of the genus Aglaia synthesizing flavaglines are commonly used for their therapeutic properties. We can therefore wonder whether these plants could not also be effective as herbal therapies against emerging diseases such as COVID-19 by a population that cannot get access to expensive drugs.
